title: Anton Bauer 2014 Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)
description: Peachy notes are accentuated by a very floral, creamy touch of oak to create a very appetizing, inviting nose. The palate is more rounded, flanked by sonorous but subtle oak spice and gentle fruit with a core of freshness and life that comes together on the long, spicy finish.

title: Boundary Breaks 2014 Ice Wine Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Bitter orange rind and spice notes accent layers of sweet honey, pineapple and mango in this lusciously sweet, silky ice wine. Strikes of lemon-lime acidity add zest and vibrance through a long, lingering finish.

title: Brian Carter Cellars 2011 Byzance Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Grenache (56%) takes the lead on this blend, which also includes Syrah, Mourvèdre, Counoise and Cinsault. It offers aromas of celery salt, coffee and dark berries. The palate brings fruit flavors that display the best this vintage has to offer—richness without excessive weight. The finish persists.

title: MontGras 2012 Intriga Maxima Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Currant aromas blend with notes of tomato, herbs and brick dust on this tight, grabbing Cabernet. Currant and red plum flavors meet herbal notes of mint and carob, with an oak character rising up on a gritty finish. Drink through 2020.

title: North by Northwest 2013 The Explorer Series Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of coffee, toast, vanilla spice and dark fruit offer immediate appeal. The black-fruit flavors are ripe and generous, sticking around on the tart finish.

title: Terre di Giurfo 2014 Belsito Frappato (Vittoria)
description: Red rose, woodland berry and ground spice aromas lead the way on this expressive, delightful red. The vibrant palate offers juicy morello cherry, crushed raspberry and white pepper framed in zesty acidity and silky, smooth tannins. It's incredibly easy to drink.

title: Santa Rita 2011 Pehuén Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: This is a heavily oaked Carmenère, so aromas of caramel, vanilla and licorice share space on the bouquet with stewed, foresty notes. Plump and saturated in feel, this is more mellow and soft than tough or tannic. Roasted blackberry, toast and spicy oak flavors end big and heavily, with leftover oak and herbal notes. Drink through 2018.

title: Proidl 2014 Ehrenfels Riesling (Niederösterreich)
description: Once initial notes of tropical passion fruit blow off, the palate shows a spectrum of citrus: from sharp lemon to aromatic mandarin, helped along by a little residual sugar. This is as refreshing and light as a cool breeze. Finishes dry.

title: Full Pull & Friends 2011 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This négociant-style wine offers immediate appeal. Aromas of lemon, candle wax, mineral, lees and toast are followed by lively, sleek citrus flavors. This was a banner vintage for Washington whites and this wine is batting cleanup.

title: Gamache 2012 Vineyard Select Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Champoux and Ciel du Cheval vineyards each make up 40% of this wine, with the balance coming from Gamache. It's locked-up tightly at present with earth, tar, cherry, high-toned herb and barrel-spice aromas leading to focused black-fruit flavors that display elegance and persistence. Give it time to open up.

title: Genoa 2012 Danforth Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: The pencil lead, herb and vanilla aromas start out light and elusive. The black-cherry flavors, in contrast, are expressive, showing a good sense of balance and length.

title: Erwin Sabathi 2014 Pössnitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)
description: There is a smoky edge to the grassy notes on this slightly aromatic white. Underneath there is some appealing, creamy citrus that puts the palate on a different, more serious footing. This is very fresh and very light, but it has character.

title: Hermann J. Wiemer 2013 Late Harvest Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: White blossoms and grapefruit zest perfume this crystalline late harvest Riesling. Veiled by a gossamer spray of sugary lace rather than streaks of honey, it showcases peach and apricot flavors in their most pristine and primary state. It's dancingly delicate on the palate yet endures dramatically on the finish.

title: Heron Hill 2014 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: A hint of pine fronds lends a cool, alpine touch to tart white peach and pineapple flavors in this vivacious dry Riesling. Zesty acidity enlivens the midpalate and extends out the finish. Drink now–2017.

title: Hirsch 2014 Grub Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Spice and saltiness are corralled into a tight frame of citrus freshness. The palate is zesty while the varietal white pepper and herb notes of Grüner shimmer here and there. Very slender with a refreshing, lively palate.

title: Hosmer 2014 Riesling (Cayuga Lake)
description: While the nose is restrained, the palate of this off-dry Riesling bursts with sweet, luscious pink grapefruit, guava and peach flavors. It's refreshingly crisp, yet deeply concentrated with a lingering, almost berried touch of sweetness on the finish. Drink now–2016.

title: Innocent Bystander 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This Australian (Yarra Valley-based) brand has bottled an excellent Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. It's plump and ample in the mouth, while the aromas are laced with hints of struck flint, snow pea, celery leaf and gooseberry, all woven into fine balance and possessing a long, mouthwatering finish.

title: Iron Horse 2008 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: Copper-pink hues shade the experience of this vintage sparkling wine, a dry expression of a warm year. It's dotted in crisp, refreshing flavors of watermelon, grapefruit and lemon zest.

title: Greywacke 2013 Wild Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Struck flint and tomato leaf notes add welcome complexity to this wine's grapefruit aromas and flavors. For a wild-ferment Sauvignon Blanc, it's reasonably clean, with moderate body and a long, dry finish.

title: Hajszan Neumann 2014 Nussberg Gemischter Satz White (Vienna)
description: Nose and palate are a fortuitous blend of lemon freshness and mirabelle ripeness. This is slender and fresh, fragrant and fruity with a whistle-clean finish and a real power to refresh and revive.

title: Keuka Lake Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown and Bottled Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: There's a steely polish to this laser-focused dry Riesling. Crisp apple, lemon and grapefruit flavors are refreshing, but serve more as a backdrop to intense minerality. It's a brisk yet penetrating wine with a long, linear finish. Drink now–2017.

title: Keuka Spring 2014 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Lime zest and grassy herb notes infuse freshness into this dry, light-footed Riesling. It's particularly sprightly in feel, a crush of tart white grapefruit and pineapple flavors, but it penetrates long on the finish, accented by a kiss of citrus blossoms. Drink now–2017.

title: Foley 2013 T Anchor Ranch Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling, an ode to Bill Foley's Texas roots, is reserved on the nose with hints of yellow melon, peach blossom and a kiss of vanilla. The palate is straightforward and very drinkable, with seared brown pear and sea-salt flavors cruising across lemon-pith texture and a chalky grip.

title: Graf Hardegg 2014 Steinbügel Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Smoke, yeast, earth and peppery herbs unite to make an almost archetypal Grüner. The palate has the same savory core but also introduces green and yellow pear to create a very harmonious, textured palate that just sings with spice and pepper.

title: Five Star Cellars 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The mocha, spice and dark raspberry aromas seem quite locked-up at present. The red and black fruit flavors meanwhile show subtlety and depth.

title: Lenz Moser 2012 Prestige Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Black tar hovers over blueberry and black cherry fruit. The palate reveals ripe, intensely aromatic blueberry notes and firm freshness. Tannins have a smooth grip. What could be more juicy or berry-tastic?

title: Arndorfer 2014 Strasser Weinberge Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Earth and yeast combine with savory herbs to make a very spicy opening that seasons the fruity, pear-scented palate. This is light but very peppery with overtones of chervil and lovage. The body is linear but very refreshing and very moreish.

title: Château Bel Air 2012  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion
description: Even if there is only 10% Cabernet Franc in the blend, it really adds to the perfumed nature of this wine. Along with smoky flavors from the wood aging, it also has structured black-currant fruits and layers of acidity. Age this wine a little longer, and drink from 2017.

title: Château Cap Léon Veyrin 2013  Listrac-Médoc
description: This wine is full, structured and rich with tannins and black-plum fruits. The hints of 12 months wood-aging are still there, just beginning to soften and allow the fruit to fill out the wine. Juicy acidity at the end mingles with the tannins. The wine will age, so drink from 2018.

title: Château de France 2013  Pessac-Léognan
description: This wine is ripe and rich with plenty of citrus as well as fresh pineapple and pear flavors. It has a great tangy character, fresh and steely with minerality. It needs time, so drink from 2019. The property is owned by Bernard Thomassin; his son Arnaud restructured vineyards for higher quality. A fire in 2011 resulted in construction of a new winery.
